revised_title: Discovery and Properties of Metallic Titanium
tldr: Dr. Wollaston discovered metallic titanium in small cubic crystals found in iron furnace slag. He found that titanium is harder than pyrites and can scratch glass. It is resistant to various acids and can be dissolved using a combination of nitre and borax. Titanium conducts electricity and does not unite with common metals like tin, lead, silver, or copper. The author suggests that titanium crystals form through a reduction of oxide dissolved in the surrounding slag.
